thread.title: Mayweather says he's 'officially out of retirement' for McGregor
thread.title_full: Mayweather says he's 'officially out of retirement' for McGregor

author: Agence France-Presse
title: Mayweather says he's 'officially out of retirement' for McGregor
text: Boxing Mayweather says he's 'officially out of retirement' for McGregor Floyd Mayweather Jr says he is ending his retirement but the fight with Conor McGregor is still far from a done deal Published 4:01 AM, March 12, 2017 Updated 4:01 AM, March 12, 2017 BACK IN ACTION? Floyd Mayweather has been retired since 2015 but may be lured back to the ring for a payday against UFC champion Conor McGregor. Photo by Al Bello/Getty Images/AFP LOS ANGELES, USA - Retired unbeaten boxing champion Floyd Mayweather says that when it comes to a possible big-money fight with Irish mixed martial arts star Conor McGregor, he is "out of retirement." In a posting on a boxing website, the 40-year-old American said he wants to face McGregor, 28, in June. "For Conor McGregor, I'm coming out of retirement, just to fight Conor McGregor," Mayweather told FightHype, according to the posting. "Today, I'm officially out of retirement for Conor McGregor. We don't need to waste no time. We need to make this... happen quickly. Let's get it on in June." Mayweather had matched Rocky Marciano's iconic 49-0 unbeaten career record when he walked away from boxing as the welterweight champion in 2015. Speculation of a Mayweather-McGregor fight has intensified in recent months, with the US star saying he is willing to meet McGregor in a boxing ring. McGregor, however, is under contract to the Ultimate Fighting Championship series, which would have to approve any deal for the bout to happen. "I don't want to hear no more excuses about the money, about the UFC," Mayweather said. "Sign the paper with the UFC so you can fight me in June. Simple and plain. Let's fight in June. If you want to fight, sign the paperwork, let's do it." McGregor is on a break for the impending birth of his first child, a son with his long-time girlfriend Dee Devlin, who is due to give birth in May. â€“ Rappler.com HOW DOES THIS STORY MAKE YOU FEEL?
